page.title: 13THE LANCASTER CANAL-USES
page.content: The canal brings benefit to Lancaster in many different ways. It is very popular for pleasure cruisers, in fact there are more boats per mile than on any other canal. The canal can also be used by dinghies and canoes. There are many types of fish in the water, so fishing is a very popular activity. The canal supports a lot of wildlife, with many water birds, and other types in the hedgrows. There is always a wide range of wild flowers along the canal bank. There are many interesting items along the canal. Just North of the city is the Lune Aqueduct, built in 1797. There are many bridges, built of stone, some of them with grooves where the ropes from horseboats wore them away. There are old wharves with iron rings to tie up the boats. However there are no locks on the main part of the canal, it was cleverly built to avoid them.
